page.title: 07TRANSPORT
page.content: All the big lorries used to go through our village to get to the docks at Immingham and the oil refineries. The main road through the village was very dangerous and a lorry crashed into the telephone box and knocked it down. Now there is a new motorway link road and most of the big lorries go round the village. There used to be a fly-over the railway at Ulceby Skitter but now that has been taken away and there is a level crossing with big gates. You have to wait until the trains have gone. The children who live at Ulceby Skitter used to have to walk to school but the taxi brought them because the road was so dangerous. This year they were going to stop the taxi because there are no lorries but some Mums got up a petition and the Council decided to keep Mrs. Toyne's taxi anyway.
